page.title: 08DEVELOPMENT IN PEWSEY VALE
page.content: In the area in which we live,the old cottages are gradually being bought up by retired people, or used as weekend retreats by people from towns. The prices of these houses are much more than the local people can afford. The young people are forced to move away to find work. The child population is falling and if this continues the future of the school, in the long term, is doubtful. The village of Oare is class 'C' for planning purposes, which means there can be no new building except for infilling, and no new building is allowed in the countryside. We do not want to spoil our village, but we think some limited building should be allowed to provide houses to encourage younger people to stay.
